[]Author: Hil;
Rating: 1
When: 4 months ago
My door card didn‚Äôt work and I replaced it twice a day i stayed here. I asked them to replace it and had to go downstairs every day I stayed at this hotel. The last two days of my trip I received a new card for my room twice. One in the morning, one at night. The staff would apologize and wouldn‚Äôt do anything to solve the main problem. It‚Äôs frustrating to go up and down to find out that I can‚Äôt get into the room. The room service left my room door open after cleaning it our second day. The heat would barely work and I would come back to my room finding the window wide open. It‚Äôs 40 degrees out. I stayed here 6 days and I checked out leaving sick.

Author: Jaime Plath;
Rating: 5
When: 3 months ago
We spent two nights at the Westin Vendome for our New Years trip to Paris. We were beyond excited to be in the city of love! Upon arrival at the Westin we were told the room wasn‚Äôt ready although we were there at the scheduled check in time of 3pm. The front desk staff did everything they could do to find us a room that was cleaned and ready but as Titanium Elite members we had already been upgraded to the largest room in our room category they had available. We were obviously ready to hit the ground running and get out into the city but we were requested to wait until our room was ready. However that time was undetermined so we were given a courtesy drink at the bar for each of us. While they held our luggage we made our way to the bar where we were delightfully surprised at the ambiance and friendly staff. Plus the drinks were delicious! We thought it was an amazing start to our few days in Paris as we sat enjoying our cocktails and snacks. After an hour our room was still not ready and the staff comped another round of drinks for us. Although it was frustrating not to be able to get in and clean up after arriving from the long trip and embarking on the city but we really enjoyed the relaxed start to the weekend and were thankful for the time at the bar. Once we got checked into our room we were able to get to the streets of Paris! We made it back to our room later that night to find a bottle of champagne and chocolate provided on the house! We were recently engaged and couldn‚Äôt have been more pleased at the service the Westin was providing. Excellent touch! The following evening we were upgraded to a suite which exceeded out expectation! It was HUGE! We had two balconies which gave us a view of the Tuileries garden. We thoroughly enjoyed the extra space especially the sitting room area. Lastly of note was the breakfast, which was comprised of a full buffet including everything from pastries & coffees to made to order eggs. We enjoyed this every morning as a perfect start to our day. We would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris - great location, excellent amenities & incredible staff.

Author: Alex Everything;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
my stay was great. the staff are helpful and the rooms are well furnished.i have used this hotel for all my Paris trips. it has a great continental breakfast with everything from sushi to omelets. so if I could I would rate it not 1 not 2 not the not four not five but six stars. visit it our forever wish you had is my advice.

Author: Kenya Avidis;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago

Author: Ali El;
Rating: 1
When: a year ago
this is really the worst Hotel I've ever seen. This hotel is getting long in the tooth... I was here in September.. I can absolutely not recommend this hotel: bad service! Great for the live music but the venue is small and a bit cramped. Expect to pay 7 euro per person on top of your drinks bill. Also the open mic nights can be hit or miss.

Author: Daniel Nordberg;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
Good but small venue. There is a ‚Ç¨7 extra charge on your obligatory first drink. I enjoyed myself and the atmosphere was great. After the concert there is a free for all jam session, I however couldn't stay long. Recommended!

Author: Roberto Rupcich;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Great time watching live Jazz with some very talented musicians! Above what I was expecting. The show is in a smaller room upstairs where they cram quite a bit of people. Fortunately, they don‚Äôt let people smoke up there. Chairs are not very comfortable. Drinks are good and prices are 10-14‚Ç¨ per drink. Go before the live shows and happy hour downstairs is fun with cheaper drinks. Server was very friendly although a little slow since he was the only one upstairs attending to the live music room. My wife and I had a great experience here but it was certainly due to the music. Go check it out! They seems to hire very talented artists! Very impressed!

I feel sorry for any musician who performs here. They are treated like factory animals and abused in the most despicable way by the manager and owner of this club. Avoid this place like you would avoid any toxic waste. Horrible.

Author: Vik Dowlul;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
A tad pricey but you have to remember the music is free. A lot of seating although your luck where you end up. We were up stairs which was good. TVs dotted about to watch the action to while listening to the music. Wine was good and location is close to the metro. Recommended if in the area.

Author: Jessica Campos;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
I had an amazing night with friends. Staff really nice! I forgot I was in a super crowded street! Parisian prices but you can stay until 4am relax! Music was AMAZING! There is a vibe in this place!

Author: Derek Erb;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
My favourite jazz club in Paris. I've been going here for over 20 years. Excellent musicians from around the world. Good drinks at average club prices. But great small club ambiance. Arrive at least 30 minutes before performance to get good seats.

[]Author: Cyril Martinot;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Interesting place with a lot going on, went there for the exhibition on protestation and loved it!

Author: Alexander Fuchs;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
Good collection of art. We showed up in time for our time slot but still had to wait 30min in line. Famous facade is currently under construction (August 2020)

Author: Helen Cotton;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
Loved this bizarre building and extensive art. Annoyingly the small rucksack that everywhere else has been allowed in had to be left in the cloakroom and we were told no water bottles inside. An absence of refill stations isnt acceptable these days either. However, the art work is superb and the public spaces capacious with charging sockets meaning the bored teen could entertain himself whilst I finished pottering. Views splendid too. Definitely a must visit.

Author: Ruben van Jaarsveld;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
Great museum. Very nice collection of modern art. Wish there was more information on the building itself.

[]Author: Thomas Brittain;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
One of my favorite places to visit in Paris. Unbelievable friendly and upbeat atmosphere. Small cover charge to enter but do not let that discourage you. Look this place up online first to see who is playing what night, but honestly I‚Äôve never been to a bad show here. All of their musicians are fantastic. On your next trip to Paris make this a stop, it will end up being one of the highlights of your trip. Remember to show up when the doors open so that you can ensure you get a good seat.

Author: Hailey Frazier;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
A hidden Jazz Gem! My husband and I had the most charming date night EVER here! The live underground swing band was amazing and we danced the night away!! It‚Äôs located in a great spot so you can easily grab food before or after going dancing! There was a decent sized crowd, small enough to still feel intimate but large enough to have a blast! We will be visiting again, on our next trip!!

It‚Äôs frustrating to go up and down to find out that I can‚Äôt get into the room. The room service left my room door open after cleaning it our second day. When: 3 months ago
We spent two nights at the Westin Vendome for our New Years trip to Paris. We were beyond excited to be in the city of love! Upon arrival at the Westin we were told the room wasn‚Äôt ready although we were there at the scheduled check in time of 3pm. The front desk staff did everything they could do to find us a room that was cleaned and ready but as Titanium Elite members we had already been upgraded to the largest room in our room category they had available. We were obviously ready to hit the ground running and get out into the city but we were requested to wait until our room was ready. However that time was undetermined so we were given a courtesy drink at the bar for each of us. While they held our luggage we made our way to the bar where we were delightfully surprised at the ambiance and friendly staff. Plus the drinks were delicious! We thought it was an amazing start to our few days in Paris as we sat enjoying our cocktails and snacks. After an hour our room was still not ready and the staff comped another round of drinks for us. Although it was frustrating not to be able to get in and clean up after arriving from the long trip and embarking on the city but we really enjoyed the relaxed start to the weekend and were thankful for the time at the bar. Once we got checked into our room we were able to get to the streets of Paris! We made it back to our room later that night to find a bottle of champagne and chocolate provided on the house! We were recently engaged and couldn‚Äôt have been more pleased at the service the Westin was providing. Excellent touch! The following evening we were upgraded to a suite which exceeded out expectation! It was HUGE! We had two balconies which gave us a view of the Tuileries garden. We thoroughly enjoyed the extra space especially the sitting room area. Lastly of note was the breakfast, which was comprised of a full buffet including everything from pastries & coffees to made to order eggs. We enjoyed this every morning as a perfect start to our day. We would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris - great location, excellent amenities & incredible staff.
